definitions.definition: the part around the neck of a piece of clothing, usually sewn on and sometimes made of different material:
a strap made of leather or other strong material that is put around the neck of an animal, especially a dog or cat:
examples: I grabbed the dog by the collar and dragged it out of the room.

definitions.definition: a type of necklace (= a piece of jewellery worn around the neck):
an area around the neck of an animal that is coloured differently from the other parts of the body:
examples: The bird has grey feathers with a lighter collar.

definitions.definition: a strip of strong material that is put around a pipe or a piece of machinery to make it stronger or to join two parts together
to catch and hold someone so that they cannot escape:
examples: She was collared by the police at the airport.

definitions.definition: to find someone and stop them from going somewhere, often so that you can talk to that person about something:
examples: I was collared by Pete as I was coming out of the meeting this morning.
